run.summary: Evolved /whatif plugin into /spark: expanded lens library 48→111 across 8 categories, investigated serendipity philosophy leading to wonder-prototype branch, renamed and registered as Claude Code plugin. Built comprehensive 158-test suite.

what-worked.item: Deep investigation into serendipity conditions revealed core insight: LLM bridging kills discovery
Category pools increase variety without breaking structure
macOS-compatible test patterns (no timeout, no set -e, ANSI stripping)
Wonder prototype philosophy: friction over explanation, questions not answers
Naming exercise: spark signals ignition not conclusion

what-didnt.item: Plugin not recognized in same session (needs restart to load)
Wonder prototype's 30s silence untested with real user

key-insights.insight: Real serendipity needs: prepared mind + unexpected encounter + recognition moment + integration work. Plugin was failing last three by bridging for user.
Spark (ignition) beats whatif (speculation) or shazam (magic) as name — signals beginning not conclusion.
AGI vision emerged: reef as gossip network for AI memory, polips as self-organizing distributed intelligence.

next-session.item: Try wonder-prototype for real to evaluate silence
Explore: What if AI spawns autonomous reef ecosystems?
Fix domain injection noise (filter common code terms)
